ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The ideas behind the world order.Yes. A great course into the "softer side" of international relations. The course shows that ideas do after all matter in the world.
A great class for anyone interested in history, political philosophy, global affairs, or current events. You should take it.
The best class I have taken at Yale.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: In contrast to many classes in International Relations and Political Science that take the micro view into things, the class gave an excellent macro-view about the international system, showing how ideas from the past still affect the behavior of actors in our days.
This prepared me for a future in leadership and public service.
